title: Industry 5.0 is the next big leap for India

title: What AI got right. Lessons for the rest of the business world.
description: As artificial intelligence reshapes industries, experts say non-tech companies can learn from Silicon Valley's playbook.

title: New study sheds light on what kinds of workers are losing jobs to AI
description: Stanford University research offers insights for students and young workers as artificial intelligence begins to reshape the labor market.
content:
Artificial intelligence is replacing entry-level workers whose jobs can be performed by generative AI tools like ChatGPT, a rigorous new study finds.
Early-career employees in fields that are most exposed to AI have experienced a 13% drop in employme... [4402 chars]

title: OpenAI To Expand Crisis Support, Add Parental Controls After Couple Blames ChatGPT For Son's Death
description: Leading global artificial intelligence company OpenAI has announced adding parental controls and emergency contact tools to its chatbot, ChatGPT, after legal action from the parents of a 16-year-old boy. The US tech giant faces a lawsuit from the parents of the teen who alleged that ChatGPT played a role in their son’s suicide.
content: Leading global artificial intelligence company OpenAI has announced adding parental controls and emergency contact tools to its chatbot, ChatGPT, after legal action from the parents of a 16-year-old boy. The US tech giant faces a lawsuit from the par... [1113 chars]

title: Nvidia’s AI chip sales surge again in latest quarter
description: Nvidia’s sales of its artificial intelligence chipsets remained a hot commodity during the company’s latest quarter, but the demand wasn’t quite feverish enough to ease recent worries that the AI craze may be fading.
content:

title: Professor debuts AI sidekick in trailblazing course
description: A new Simon Fraser University course this fall marks a world first: a university professor teaching alongside a live, fully expressive 3D artificial intelligence collaborator on stage. This pioneering course introduces a new model for human-AI interaction in an academic setting, positioning SFU at the forefront of educational innovation.
content:

title: Poll suggests 85% of Canadians want governments to regulate AI
description: OTTAWA — A new poll indicates an overwhelming majority of Canadians are in favour of regulating artificial intelligence. The Leger poll found 85 per cent of respondents believe governments should regulate AI tools to ensure ethical and safe use.
content:
OTTAWA — A new poll indicates an overwhelming majority of Canadians are in favour of regulating artificial intelligence.
The Leger poll found 85 per cent of respondents believe governments should regulate AI tools to ensure ethical and safe use.
